original_title: Sri Lanka coconut auction prices down 14-pct in 2024
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s coconut prices fell from 70,067.49 to 64,958.37 for 1,000 nuts at an auction January 11, 2023, official data shows.
According to the Coconut Development Board, the highest price is 77,000 rupees and the lowest price is 55,000 rupees.
The auction offered 684,848 coconuts and 567,968 coconuts were sold.
Average auction prices are down 14.3 percent from 75,879 seen in the last auction of 2023.
Lower export demand is a factor in falling prices, an industry official said.
Farmgate prices in Kurunegala were 68,000 to 70,000 rupees a nut.
In the week to December 28, the wholesale price of large coconuts were 100 to 105 rupees a nut and small 85 to 92 rupees.
Retail prices were 110 to 130 rupees for large coconuts and 90 to 100 rupees for small ones.
Coconut shells were 26,000 to 28,000 rupees a metric tonne. (Colombo/Jan13/2023)
